Dear John,

Here is your latest Global Economy update from World News.

Global economic growth is projected to slow to 2.9% this year, down from 3.2% in the previous year, according to the latest IMF report. Key factors include persistent inflation, higher interest rates, and geopolitical tensions affecting trade flows.

Major central banks are maintaining cautious monetary policies, with some beginning to consider rate cuts later in the year if inflation continues to moderate. Emerging markets show mixed performance, with some regions benefiting from increased commodity prices while others face currency pressures.

We'll continue to monitor these developments and provide timely updates.

Best regards,
The World News Team.
